name: Emerald catfish
remarks: The Emerald Cory Catfish is a very hardy and resilient fish.  Disease should not be a concern provided that you maintain the aquarium to standards.[6]

name: Peppered corydoras, salt and pepper catfish
Pygmy corydoras
remarks: A very peaceful species, that does not make an ideal community fish due to its small adult size. It is easily intimidated by larger tank mates and will not compete well with them for food.[10]

name: Threestripe corydoras, leopard catfish, false julii cory
Bristlenose pleco, bushynose pleco
remarks: The bristlenose genus has at least 59 identified species and many others yet to be named.[14] Males and female both have long "bristles" on their nose, the males having distinctly longer ones.

name: Whiptail catfish
remarks: It is a peaceful fish that is best kept in good sized groups (6+) in a mature tank with plenty of shady hiding spots amongst plants, driftwood, slate caves, and PVC pipes.[15]

name: Common pleco, suckermouth catfish, Amazon sailfin catfish
Common pleco, suckermouth catfish
remarks: Adults can become very territorial and aggressive towards each other. It is difficult to keep 2 adult common plecos together.[16]

name: Leopard sailfin pleco, clown sailfin pleco
Zebra pleco, L-046
remarks:
One of the most popular Hypancistrus species.
Endangered.[17]

name: Clown Pleco ( L104, L162, and LDA22)[18]
remarks: primary diet consists of wood, in aquaria this is provided in the source of drift wood. Will appreciate blanched vegetables, and/ or algae (wafer or live)[18]

name: Redtail catfish
min_tank_size: Needs at least a 2,600 US gallons (9,800 L) tank when mature, even though this does not provide them with the space to show their natural behaviour.[22]

name: Ornate Pimelodus
remarks: Similar to catfish but not in the same genus

name: Upside-down catfish
remarks: S. nigriventris prefers bottom feeding on Tubifex (or similar worms), but its main diet consists of algae.[23] The blotched upside-down catfish is well suited to aquariums because of its small size (typically 9 or 10 cm or less) and peaceful demeanor.[citation needed]

name: Walking catfish
remarks: The albino form is common in the aquarium trade. This fish can survive out of the water and "walk" as long as kept wet, for a very long time.[25]

name: Chao Phraya giant shark, giant pangasius
